page.title: 14Motorway Comes To Codsall
page.content: They stood sentry-like and silent apart from the echoes of the wind and the distant calls of birds. The plant life had been left virtually undisturbed for centuries and southern Marsh Orchids in particular proliferated.Badgers, foxes, stoats, weasels and squirrels abounded. Then came the Motorway. I stayed at the Temple for six months and saw scenes to break the heart of any country loving person. Strong,tall trees, over a hundred years old, nudged to the ground in as many minutes. The new road cut a long,curved swathe through the woods, slicing through the approach track and missing the rear of Temple Cottage by 40 yards. Gone were the trees and all the wild life of any description,and in their place an unbearable construction noise. Now the woods echo to the drone of traffic, the Grecian Temple Cottage is deserted and men call it progress.
